It’s the sort of conduct one would expect from a petty dictator not from the leader of the free world. This is a flagrant abuse of power and it cannot stand.

I relate my personal history professional background & legislative priorities because they are critical to understanding my vote to impeach the President for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress. It’s a vote I will cast with great reluctance but with even greater resolve

After all the work that I and other elected leaders from both parties have done to protect our democratic process from foreign interference the President sought to coerce a foreign leader for his own benefit — and got caught in the act.
It sounds like a cliché but I consider myself a patriot not a partisan. I put country over party because that’s what I’ve always done and because the nature of my district demands it.

As a national security specialist I helped develop & execute our strategy to use military assistance to build the capacity of partner nations in support of our shared goals. I saw how vital this effort is to defending our nation protecting our friends & deterring our enemies.

My parents instilled in me a deep love and appreciation for America. They taught me this is an exceptional country. It’s a country that elects and empowers its national leaders while constraining those powers through a carefully designed constitutional framework.

Like other immigrants and refugees to this country I know how fortunate I am to call America home. When I was a baby my family fled Vietnam because our lives were threatened by a communist government that exercised ruthless power unchecked by the rule of law.

Before I take any hard vote I ask myself 3 questions: Is this good for my country? Is this the right thing for my constituents even if some will disagree with me? And is this consistent with my conscience? Because I can answer “yes” to all I will vote to impeach the President. https://t.co/fvDeqLZ7v4
